snippet.title: Trains suspended as truck hits crossing
snippet.content:
COMMUTERS have been warned of delays on the roads and the rail network after a truck carrying a load of cotton reportedly collided with a rail bridge. A member of the public reported the incident on Sherwood Rd to police after cotton spilled across the road about 8am. Police have arrived on scene and diversions are in place. .
A truck has become lodged under the rail bridge over Sherwood & Ipswich Rds. Extensive traffic delays. Watch for diversion directions.
They have urged motorists to be mindful of delays and to not drive on the wrong side of the road to avoid the truck.
Trains are suspended at Rocklea due to a bridge strike. Significant delays are expected on the Beenleigh, G.Coast, Airport & F.Grove lines
Translink has warned commuters travelling on the Beenleigh and Gold Coast lines to expect delays of up to an hour. Both line are suspended. More to come.
